title: Ticket #4096: condor_status -t only works as last option
description:
Reported: 8.0, may be older.

Reproduced by adesmet in 8.0.0 and 8.1.0 Jun 25 2013 BuildID: UW_development PRE-RELEASE-UWCS (There was hope that recent cleanup in argument parsing in 8.1 might fix the bug as a side effect. It didn't.)

The -t option to condor_status must be the last option, although -total works in any position. 

% condor_status -t -pool condor
% condor_status -pool condor -t
                     Total Owner Claimed Unclaimed Matched Preempting Backfill

         INTEL/LINUX    56    12       1        43       0          0        0
        X86_64/LINUX  1356   385      84       887       0          0        0

               Total  1412   397      85       930       0          0        0
% condor_status -total -pool condor
                     Total Owner Claimed Unclaimed Matched Preempting Backfill

         INTEL/LINUX    56    12       1        43       0          0        0
        X86_64/LINUX  1356   385      84       887       0          0        0

               Total  1412   397      85       930       0          0        0
remarks:
2013-Nov-22 14:41:36 by adesmet:
The command line options -totals and -target were conflicting. -totals was earlier, so it gets to win. Also -totals is tested in both the first and second passes, and in the other pass it was already requiring a longer match, suggesting it should require the more complete argument.

One line fix on V8_0-4096-branch as c7053a716ded2fe7e7ad211850bb9bfe26b7bda8 [38823], requires review.

The argument parsing code in condor_status really should be burned to the ground, but that's a different ticket.

2013-Nov-22 15:16:11 by jfrey:
Code Review

This change looks good.

2013-Nov-22 15:34:49 by adesmet:
Merged into V8_0-branch as c7053a716ded2fe7e7ad211850bb9bfe26b7bda8
